title: No One Lives Forever Playthrough -- Part 1
description: Loved this game as a kid, so I'm excited to finally be playing it through all the way. Such a classic!
gameName: The Operative: No One Lives Forever

fragments.text: are you popping your cherry with this game?
man, this game looks more triangular than I remembered, talk about nostalgia
It still looks kind of good for 2000 doesnt it?
not sure, to be honest, my memory of the time is too corrupted to say for sure
same era of FPS as Soldier of Fortune
the question is, however, does this game parody other things besides old bond films?
what engine does this run on, by the way?
looks very SoF or Deus Ex
lith tech seems to be googles answer
yeah, shogo was an earlier version

what a dapper fellow that one

better get training or you wont know what to do!
"how to skip cut scenes" the tutorial XD
this may be my second favorite tutorial: the best one being the one for Far Cry Blood Dragon
"press f to confirm you can read"
Press C to confirm you're not blind.
Well, at least it's an easy paycheck.

use the lockpick to punch the keylock off

It is really hard to play all these mission on stealth and by stealth I mean 0 encounters and 0 body founds, it is really hard, especially in the later levels, the one in Germany is quiet hard to distract them to another point

the second one is also good
and of course the spin off

so we should have killed him for them
yeah, that's a pretty typical yank

you need a certain gadget to cross over this
RTCW was id tech 3 aka the Quake 3 engine

but fun fact: if you dont kill both guys before the one guy shoots the other, it still counts as "body founds", so you have to interrupt the chat between them

because if they were talking in another language you couldn't understand it
encryptio, you have the option for subtitles

cube what game is better than bioshock in the ways that make bioshock a good game? which i would say are 'story/setting/atmosphere' and classic FPS gameplay mechanics? i think this is a case in which system shock 2 might not be the answer because it's not so much an FPS as those gameplay elements less refined to incorporate RPG elements.
the reason i specify bioshock is it was so well reviewed and remembered, the question is essentially whether there is a 'bioshock killer'
and i feel there SHOULD be, because both bioshock 1 and 2 have obvious shortcomings. but then you have to ask, what game would that be, or does it not exist
Say anyone here played Binary domain? it is quite interesting
I only say interesting because it was a decent game that I got for free xD
my only gripe about the game is the way they do third person controls

still better than farcry primal water on consoles
I really liked this game as a kid picked it up for a few quid and was really pleased

NOLF is pretty good. Shows its age a bit, but still

oh this is dated? i had the same feeling right away when i tried it a couple years ago. at the time, it was the most original fps game, and it reinvented a lot of game design in a better way. it was so good that pretty much every game after it was influenced by it and follows in certain design choices. but it's so primitive that it's not as enjoyable as it used to be
this game felt like 'goldeneye 007 on the pc'

too bad there isn't any health to find
body wouldnt even hold in a glass of water

actually maybe i was wrong about the game being original, it was goldeneye 007, but for the glorious pc master race. that made it historically similar to far cry, because it was one of the first of a new design.
